email.activation.body:
Hello,

To activate your account, click the link below:
%s

If you did not request this, you can ignore this message.
email.activation.regen.body:
Hello,

Here is a new link to activate your account:
%s

If you did not request this email, you can ignore it.
email.activation.regen.subject: New link to activate your account
email.activation.subject: Activate your account
email.change.confirm.body:
Hello,

To confirm your new email, click here:
%s

This link expires in 24h.
email.change.confirm.subject: Confirm your new email
email.change.revert.body:
Hello,

Your email was changed to: %s
If you did not do this, you can revert it here (valid 365 days):
%s
email.change.revert.subject: Your email was changed
email.dm.subject: [CercaGenealogica] New message from %s
email.dm.body:
Hello,

You received a new message from %s.

Read it here:
%s
email.dm.body.snippet:
Hello,

You received a new message from %s.

Read it here:
%s

Excerpt:
%s
email.password.changed.body:
Hello,

Your account password has been updated. If this wasn't you, start the password recovery flow from the home page.
email.password.changed.subject: Your password has been changed
email.reset.body:
Hello,

We received a request to recover your account. Click this link to confirm (it expires in 24h):
%s

If you did not request this, you can ignore this email.
email.reset.complete.body:
Hello,

We have reset your password. Your new temporary password is:
%s

For security, change it after you log in.
email.reset.complete.subject: Your temporary password
email.reset.subject: Reset your password

levels.col.name: Name
levels.rebuild.confirm.all: Recalculate demography and names/surnames for all levels? This can take a few minutes.
levels.rebuild.confirm.demography: Recalculate demography for all levels? This can take a few minutes.
levels.rebuild.confirm.stats: Recalculate names and surnames for all levels? This can take a few minutes.
levels.rebuild.help: Runs a rebuild to refresh aggregated tables and speed up profile pages.
levels.rebuild.subtitle: Admin only
levels.rebuild.title: Recalculate level statistics
levels.form.name: Name
levels.help.code.body: These are the numeric or alphanumeric codes the country assigns to each region. Optional, but useful for matching official or statistical sources.
levels.help.code.title: Official code
levels.help.level.body: This situates the area in the country hierarchy. Typical example: 1=community/region, 2=province, 3=county, 4=municipality, 5=neighbourhood. Later you can link children via the Parent field.
levels.help.level.title: What is Level (1..7)?
levels.help.name.body: Enter the official name the country uses for this level: e.g. Catalonia (autonomous community), Gipuzkoa (province/historical territory), Languedoc-Roussillon (region), Emilia-Romagna (regione italiana), Greater London (region/county), Lapurdi (department/province). Use the native denomination for the area.
levels.help.name.title: Name of the administrative unit
levels.help.parent.body: Links this level to its immediate parent (country is already set by PaisID). Example chain: community → province → county/comarca → municipality → neighbourhood. A municipality’s parent could be its county or province; a neighbourhood’s parent would be the municipality, etc.
levels.help.parent.title: How does Parent work?
levels.help.state.body: Sets whether the division is active, inactive, merged or abolished. Useful to understand current status, especially for historical cases or reorganisations.
levels.help.state.title: Division status
levels.help.type.body: Choose the category of administrative division used by the country (province, district, county, municipality, parish, etc.). Pick the one that best matches the real-world administrative unit.
levels.help.type.title: What is the Type field?
levels.help.year_end.body: Year when the division ceased or changed. Optional: leave blank if still active or if you don’t have the data.
levels.help.year_end.title: End year
levels.help.year_start.body: Year when this division began or came into force. Optional: leave blank if unknown or not applicable.
levels.help.year_start.title: Start year
levels.hist.name: Name
levels.hist.title: Historic names
levels.select.country: Select a country to add a level
levels.title: Administrative levels

importer.editor.title: Template editor
importer.editor.field.name: Name
importer.editor.merge.by_principal: By principal person if book indexed
importer.editor.transforms.desc.empty: Select a transform to see what it does.
importer.editor.transforms.param.hint.se: Parameter: default value. Example: No data
importer.editor.transforms.desc.normaliz: Normalizes chronology strings (ex: 1890-91) to match books.
importer.editor.transforms.desc.parse_da: Parses flexible dates or text into the event date.
Parses flexible dates and stores quality (doubtful, illegible...).
importer.editor.transforms.desc.parse_pe: Marcmoia variant: surname1 surname2 given names.
Marcmoia variant: maternal surname + paternal surname + given names.
Marcmoia variant: given names surname1 surname2.
Marcmoia variant: given names + maternal surname + paternal surname.
importer.editor.transforms.desc.split_co: Splits a couple joined with 'i' (ex: 'Pau i Maria').
importer.editor.transforms.desc.set_defa: If empty, set a default value (parameter).
importer.editor.transforms.desc.parse_ma: Extracts marriage order (1st, 2nd) as a number.
importer.editor.transforms.desc.strip_ma: Removes marriage order text from the field.
importer.editor.preview.empty: Add columns to see a preview.
importer.editor.help.body.name: Name used in lists. Example: "Baptisms 1890" or "Book 12 - Sant Pere".
importer.editor.help.body.description: Short note about when to use it. Example: "CSV from book 12, Catalan headers".
importer.editor.help.body.record_type: Defines which fields are available to map. Example: Baptism, Deaths, or Marriage.
importer.editor.help.body.visibility: Private is only for you; public lets others clone it. Example: make it public if it is generic.
importer.editor.help.body.separator: Force the CSV separator when auto-detect fails. Examples: comma (,), semicolon (;), pipe (|), or tab.
importer.editor.help.body.locale: Language for month names, date parsing, and normalization. Examples: cat, es, en.
importer.editor.help.body.book_mode: How the book is resolved: by direct ID or by chronology/name lookup. Example: "By llibre_id" with column "llibre_id".
importer.editor.help.body.book_column: Column that identifies the book. Examples: "llibre_id" or "cronologia".
importer.editor.help.body.cronologia_nor: Normalize values like "1890-91" before lookup. Example: enable when using chronology/name.
importer.editor.help.body.ambiguity_poli: What to do if lookup returns more than one book. Example: "Fail" to stop, "First match" to continue.
importer.editor.help.body.scope_filters: Apply context filters (country, level, etc.) during lookup. Example: enable to avoid unrelated books.
importer.editor.help.body.dedup_within: Avoid duplicates within the same file. Example: identical rows import once.
importer.editor.help.body.dedup_keys: Keys used to detect duplicates. Examples: base.data_acte_iso, persones.principal.nom, column "record_id".
importer.editor.help.body.merge_mode: How to merge with existing records. Example: "No" always creates new; "By principal person" merges on match.
importer.editor.help.body.merge_roles: Roles that define the principal person. Examples: batejat, nuvi, difunt.
importer.editor.help.body.merge_update_m: Only fill empty fields during merge. Example: keep existing values.
importer.editor.help.body.merge_add_peop: Add missing people found in the row. Example: disable to keep only existing people.
importer.editor.help.body.merge_add_attr: Add missing attributes (notes, places, etc.). Example: append extra info.
importer.editor.help.body.column_header: Exact CSV header name. Example: "Name", "Baptism date".
importer.editor.help.body.column_aliases: Other accepted header names. Example: "Nom del batejat", "Nom".
importer.editor.help.body.column_require: Mark whether the column is required to import. Example: date and principal person.
importer.editor.help.body.column_target: Where this value is stored. Examples: base.tipus_acte, base.data_acte_iso, persones.principal.nom.
importer.editor.help.body.column_transfo: Transformations before mapping. Examples: trim, lower, parse_date_flexible..., parse_person_from_cognoms, map_values. Put the parameter in the value field.
importer.editor.help.body.column_conditi: Enable an IF/ELSE rule based on the value. Example: if value == "X" map to a different target.
Boolean expression over value. Examples: value == "Home", value != "".
Alternative mapping when the condition is false. Example: ELSE maps to mare.nom.

importer.editor.help.couple: Couples: Joan X i Maria Y
